page.title: 19ECOLOGY-OUTWOOD & STANLEY
page.content: THE AREA IS IN THE RAIN SHADOW OF THE PENNINES AND HAS COOL SUMMERS, MILD WINTERS WITH SOME SNOW AND 750-1000mm ANNUAL RAINFALL. GEOLOGY IS MAINLY CARBONIFEROUS;COAL WITH SOME LIMESTONE UNDERLYING CLAY AND ALLUVIUM IN RIVER VALLEYS. SOME SANDSTONE IN STANLEY AREA.LIMEPIT LANE INDICATES LIMESTONE. WHERE COAL HAS BEEN MINED SLAG HEAPS APPEAR, WITH NO TREES ONLY HAWTHORN BUSHES. LIFE CONSISTS OF MOTHS, WASPS, RED ANTS, SOLDIER BEETLES, LADY BIRDS, AND CATERPILLARS. TREES ARE MAINLY DECIDUOUS, CONFINED MOSTLY TO ASH AND SYCAMORE. TWO STREETS ARE CALLED ASH AND SYCAMORE. POLLUTION IN SOIL FROM CHIMNEYS IN THE PAST MAY ACCOUNT FOR THIS AS THEY THRIVE ON THIS TYPE OF SOIL AND ATMOSPHERE. THE AREA CONSISTS OF FARMLAND, WASTELAND, GRAZING LAND, BUILDINGS,GARDENS,RIVER AND CANAL WITH SOME PEAT AND MARSH IN LOFTHOUSE GATE.
